author: Brad Esposito
title: People Are Freaking Out About This Ring Of Turkeys Walking Around A Dead Cat - BuzzFeed News
text:
This is when weaker animals confront predators to intimidate them and scare them away. If this is the case, the turkeys must not have known the cat was dead. Or the cat may have recently died. Hell, who knows‚Ä¶ maybe the turkeys killed the cat. ID: 10631610 5. Jonathan said the turkeys circled the dead cat for at least two minutes while he was there. His video of the encounter has over 20,000 retweets. @TheReal_JDavis the prophecy has been fulfilled.
‚Äî David Foster Waffles (@NickSeam) ID: 10631621 @TheReal_JDavis
‚Äî üë®üèº‚ÄçüöÄ (@Zincrozine) ID: 10631671 @TheReal_JDavis bro, they was waiting for u to give the eulogy
‚Äî ab_jilla (@kickzjilla) ID: 10631673 @TheReal_JDavis @NikeFiend927 lol those look like buzzards aka vultures
‚Äî L Chapo (@uwack23) ID: 10631675 9. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs unreal, man,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúMy Twitter app barely works with all the RTs. ‚ÄúPeople at work were telling me their friends from other states were watching it and had no idea they knew the person who filmed it‚Ä¶ [there were also] people yelling at me and saying [they were] vultures and not turkeys.‚Äù
For the record, Jonathan said National Geographic called him and confirmed they were turkeys.
ID: 10631630 10. BuzzFeed News has contacted Taronga Zoo too find out more information about this weird as shit phenomenon. ID: 10631679 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com! 
Brad Esposito is a news reporter for BuzzFeed and is based in Sydney, Australia. Contact Brad Esposito at bradley.esposito@buzzfeed.com . Got a confidential tip? Submit it here .
